etymologies: mid 16th century. From Middle French advoquer to summon (a legal action) to a court, to summon, call upon from classical Latin advocāre. Compare earlier revoke, provoke, etc

definitions: To summon (a legal action) from a lower court to a higher court, especially the papal Court of Rome. Compare "advocate", "advocation".

notes.text: Chiefly with reference to the legal matter of Henry VIII's divorce from Catherine of Aragon.
